title: Creating extensions in Postgres should be optional
body:
## Feature Description

PostgresDriver.enableExtensions should be an optional function.

### The Problem

For our specific use-case, we use TypeORM in a service that is using read-only client credentials. I imagine this to be a common occurrence. Since we have a `uuid` column in at least 1 of our entities, this line runs https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/src/driver/postgres/PostgresDriver.ts#L336-L341:

```
if (hasUuidColumns)
            try {
                await this.executeQuery(connection, `CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "${this.options.uuidExtension || "uuid-ossp"}"`);
            } catch (_) {
                logger.log("warn", `At least one of the entities has uuid column, but the '${this.options.uuidExtension || "uuid-ossp"}' extension cannot be installed automatically. Please install it manually using superuser rights, or select another uuid extension.`);
            }
```

Although there is no _real_ issue, we are being bombarded with logs from both Postgres and the App especially on those that periodically go up and down (think crons) 

### The Solution

One of the ways this can be solved by adding a flag at the start of the function to determine whether it should run or not. There are many (possibly better) ways to achieve this same effect.

### Considered Alternatives

Add a flag somewhere else to disable automatically running a `CREATE EXTENSION` script
